title: New York Declares State of Emergency to Combat Omicron Variant
summary: Precautionary measure allows hospitals to turn away patients seeking nonurgent care. New York's governor declared a state of emergency to prepare for a possible Covid-19 surge from the new Omicron variant that is spreading around the globe.

title: Why You Shouldn't Use Emojis in Work Messages
summary: Women are especially likely to interpret certain emojis more negatively than men do, according to a recent study. That thinking face. The eye-roll mug. The "nerd" emoji with the glasses. These cartoon images of the human face have become shorthand for complex emotions that we increasingly throw into digital communications for a host of reasons ranging from time saving to tension diffusion to literally lacking the words to describe how we feel. But are they appropriate for work-related exchanges?

title: How the Covid-19 Pandemic Changed Employee Training
summary: Say goodbye to the classroom. Companies are now figuring out how to best use technology to make sure workers learn-and retain-what they need to know.. There are some fundamental changes under way in how companies train their workers.

title: Her Classic British Roadster Stands Out on Rocky Mountain Roads
summary: Resume Subscription. Kelsey Weatherford, 23, of Woodland Park, Colo., a customer-care associate at BombBomb, on her 1980 MG MGB, as told to A.J. Baime.

title: Private Flying Takes Off, Boosting Demand for Business Jets
summary: Some well-heeled, would-be private-jet fliers are being turned away as industry booms. A boom in private flying is helping revive business-jet sales, but it is also challenging charter operators who are scrambling to meet the holiday-travel rush.

title: Democrats Tackle Changes to $2 Trillion Spending Plan
summary: Also on checklist for lawmakers: keeping government funded, increasing debt ceiling and passing defense-policy bill. WASHINGTON-Democrats will sort through a heavy pile of to-do items when they return to Washington, including ironing out disagreements over their Build Back Better bill, keeping the government funded and boosting the debt limit before the U.S. runs out of money to pay its obligations.

title: Black Friday Shopping Is Back, but the Doorbusters Aren't
summary: Consumers hit malls again even as they do more holiday shopping online. The Covid-19 pandemic didn't just change consumer habits. It also prompted retailers to rethink Black Friday, one of the biggest shopping days of the year.

title: Au Revoir to the 'Perfect Parisian Woman' Cliché
summary: A more inclusive vision of French style is in the air, as evidenced by Vogue Paris rebranding as Vogue France. What's in: forward-thinking designers and women of different backgrounds and sizes. What's out: the thin, white, rich Parisian stereotype in a trench coat.. "How to be Parisian Wherever You Are." "Lessons from Madame Chic: 20 Stylish Secrets I Learned While Living in Paris." "Parisian Charm School: French Secrets for Cultivating Love, Joy, and That Certain Je Ne Sais Quoi." "Chic and Slim Toujours." "Love Parisienne: The French Woman's Guide to Love and Passion." These are just a few of the dozens of books published in the 2000s that trafficked in the myth of the Parisian woman (or "girl," as she is often called). In these books, French women are boiled down to one reductive stereotype: the thin, white, rich Parisian sophisticate in a striped shirt, trench coat and Hermès scarf.

title: Macau Police Question Junket Boss Over Alleged Illegal Gambling Syndicate
summary: Alvin Chau, chairman of Suncity Group, held after mainland Chinese police issue arrest warrant. HONG KONG-The chairman of Macau's largest junket operator was questioned by police in the gambling hub after authorities in mainland China issued a warrant for his arrest, the Macau government said on Saturday.

title: Advertisers Adjust Holiday Messages to Current Realities
summary: Cadillac avoids advertising in markets where inventory is low; BetterHelp's ads finesse mask wearing. Companies are rethinking their advertising strategies this holiday season as multiple problems, from supply-chain constraints to continued worries about Covid-19, make it harder for brands to rely on traditional festive pitches.

title: 'Gilded Figures: Wood and Clay Made Flesh' Review: Ravishing Forms, Overlooked No More
summary: The Hispanic Society Museum & Library's exhibition brings deserved attention to richly decorated and elaborately illusionistic works.. New York

title: Only Have 20 Minutes? Three Short Workouts to Squeeze in During the Holiday Rush
summary: You don't need to spend hours in the gym this season. Food-and-drink-filled celebrations, hectic holiday schedules, shorter daylight hours and colder weather make it tough to find time to burn off calories.

title: In the Land of Dikes, Nature Now Reinforces Flood Defenses
summary: Resume Subscription. BEVEREN, Belgium-The world's levees are losing the battle against rising seas and overflowing rivers, so experts here want to learn how to fight smarter.

title: It's Time to Get Rid of the IT Department
summary: It made sense in a bygone era, when technology was separate from the business. Now it just hurts both.. No man is an island. And the IT department shouldn't be one, either.

title: Digital Technology Poses New Obstacle for U.S. Spies
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-Operatives widely suspected of working for Israel's Mossad spy service planned a stealthy operation to kill a Palestinian militant living in Dubai. The 2010 plan was a success except for the stealth part-closed-circuit cameras followed the team's every move, even capturing them before and after they put on disguises.

title: Scientists Debate Whether Immunity From Vaccine or Infection Is Stronger
summary: Resume Subscription. Evidence is building that immunity from Covid-19 infection is at least as strong as that from vaccination. Scientists are divided on the implications for vaccine policy.

title: U.K. Looks to Compete on Financial Regulation
summary: In addition to watchdog function, top regulators will be required to help boost growth and international competitiveness in sector. London wants to regain the mantle of the world's busiest financial center from New York by overhauling how banks and other financial firms are regulated after Brexit.

title: Hertz-Tesla Deal Signals Rental-Car Providers' Shift to EVs
summary: Rental providers are focusing more on electric vehicles under investor pressure to cut emissions. Car-rental customers could soon see more electric-vehicle options on airport lots and other places where they are looking to reserve a ride.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The Downside of English's Dominance
summary: The world's most commonly used language is facing a backlash and keeping its monolingual speakers from engaging with the world. When France takes over the European Council presidency in January, it has been reported that President Emmanuel Macron plans to make French its official language. Many EU diplomats who have invested time and energy in their English skills are anxious and annoyed. It's just one example of the "language wars" raging around the world, as countries from South Africa to Morocco to India come to terms with the unrelenting expansion of English.

title: Fans Pour Funding-and Faith-Into a Hit Drama About Jesus
summary: Resume Subscription. MIDLOTHIAN, Texas-Last winter 2,000 people costumed in robes and headscarves gathered on a grassy slope here to shoot the season finale of a drama with no ties to any Hollywood studio, network or streaming service. "The Chosen," a saga about the adult life of Jesus and his disciples, is financed completely by its audience. Most of the extras had paid $1,000 each to be part of the climactic scene leading up to Jesus' Sermon on the Mount.

title: Move Over, GE. The Tech Conglomerates Are the New Leaders of Industry.
summary: As General Electric and other old-school behemoths break up, Amazon, Apple, Alphabet, Microsoft and Meta are taking their place as the do-everything companies of the future. The eulogies for the corporate conglomerate have been pouring in fast. But in fact, these monsters of modern business are now bigger, more powerful and perhaps more world-consumingly durable than ever-they also look very different than in the past.
